abstract: Former Korean Air vice president Cho Hyun-Ah is released from prison after South Korean appeals court reduces her sentence; Cho was charged with violating air safety laws for ordering Korean Air plane to return to its gate after becoming enraged when flight attendant improperly served snack.
lead_paragraph: Cho Hyun-ah, who forced a plane back to its gate over how she was served nuts, is released after an appeals court reduced and then suspended her sentence.

headline.main: Ex-Korean Air Executive in ‘Nut Rage’ Case Freed From Prison After Sentence Is Cut
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; South Korea: Ex-Airline Official Freed Just Months After ‘Nut Rage’ Incident

snippet: Cho Hyun-ah, who forced a plane back to its gate over how she was served nuts, is released after an appeals court reduced and then suspended her sentence.
